title: 115_s2197
content:
The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the alternative simplified credit to 20 percent and the conforming amendment to 10 percent. These changes apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2017. Additionally, there is a provision for the allocation of research expenses among business components. SEC. 2. Allocation of research expenses among business components amended to allow for reasonable estimation techniques instead of contemporaneous accounting for employee hours per business component. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2017.

SEC. 3. Qualified upper-level employees included in research expense calculation without regard to position or management level. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2017.

SEC. 4. Repeal of exclusion of adaptive research. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF EXCLUSION OF ADAPTIVE RESEARCH. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 removes exclusion of adaptive research. Effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017. SEC. 5. INCLUSION OF COST REDUCTION RESEARCH. SEC. 5 amends the Internal Revenue Code to include cost reduction research for taxable years starting after December 31, 2017. SEC. 6 includes obsolescence mitigation. SEC. 6 amends the Internal Revenue Code to include obsolescence mitigation for taxable years starting after December 31, 2017. SEC. 7 allows for the election of reduced credit on an amended return. SEC. 7 allows for the election of reduced credit on an amended return, which must be made in the manner prescribed by the Secretary and is irrevocable once made. The amendment applies to amended returns permitted under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 8 introduces a new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, allowing for investment in connected manufacturing equipment. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows for a connected manufacturing equipment credit of 10% of qualified expenditures for industrial equipment components with microprocessors that can be connected to an electronic network, along with necessary software and network components. The Secretary, with consultation from the Secretary of Commerce, will determine eligible components for the credit. Any credit allowed will reduce the basis adjustment of the property. Conforming amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Commerce, will determine eligible components for the connected manufacturing equipment credit under section 45S(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This credit will reduce the basis adjustment of the property. Amendments are made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 to reflect this new credit. The connected manufacturing equipment credit under section 45S will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2018.
